result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Lipscomb was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael J Lipscomb is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael J Lipscomb was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Michael J Lipscomb was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered the defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $700.00, payable to Little Ceasars, 9230 W. Capitol Dr, to be paid first and foremost, through collection by the DOC from25% of funds under Sec 973.05(4)(b) and as condition of Extended Supervision. 
Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Pay all costs, surcharges and Supervision fees, to be paid through collection by the DOC from 25% of funds under Sec 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision. 
Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court determined the DOMAB surcharge is not applicable.
Concurrent with: with Count 3, consecutive to any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain GED/ HSED.
Obtain/ maintain employment.

NO CONTACT with firearms.
As a convicted felon defendant must provide DNA sample, have voting rights suspended and never posses firearms.

NO CONTACT with victim unless approved by the Court.
Defndant advised of the penalties for violation of the No Contact Order.

Complete BIP.
Attend treatment and/ or counseling as determined.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY; random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with Count 2, consecutive to any other sentence, with 112 days time-served credit.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael J Lipscomb in court with attorney Gilbert F Urfer.  Defendant Michael J Lipscomb in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Additional statements made by Michael M. and Glenetta R.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 42 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prison, concurrent with Count 3, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 112 days served.  Court ordered 18 MONTHS Initial Term Of Confinement and 24 MONTHS Extended Supervision.
.
AS TO COUNT 3:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent with Count 2, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 112 days time served.  
.
Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations of the law.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by Court.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Obtain GED/HSED.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.  Court found the domestic abuse surcharge not applicable.
- Court set restitution at $700.00 payable to Little Ceasars, 9230 W Capitol Dr, to be paid first and foremost.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence. 
.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he must provide a DNA sample, pay the surcharge, his/her voting rights are suspended and s/he may never possess firearms.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Defendant Michael J Lipscomb in court with attorney Gilbert F Urfer.  Defendant Michael J Lipscomb in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Pursuant to negotiations Count 1 is dismissed, and Count 4 is dismissed but read in for purposes of sentencing.

As to Counts 2 & 3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Jury trial of 05/05/2014 is vacated.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40 for sentencing.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.

Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael J Lipscomb in court with attorney Gilbert Fielding Urfer.  Defendant Michael J Lipscomb in custody.  Molly Marie Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Case set for final pretrial conference.  Defendant would like a plea date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Gilbert F Urfer in court, defendant Michael J Lipscomb not in court, in custody.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Scheduling Conference held off the record.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  State's motion for joinder will be addressed at the final pretrial conference.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Michael J Lipscomb in court with attorney Gilbert F Urfer.  Defendant Michael J Lipscomb in custody.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  City of Milwaukee Police Officer Ted Puente.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LASHERIKAH G., BRANDY W., OR LITTLE CEASAR'S PIZZA, 9230 W CAPITOL DR., MILWAUKEE, WI.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael J Lipscomb in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Michael J Lipscomb in custody.  Joseph C Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  AS TO MISDEMEANOR COUNTS 3 & 4:  COURT RESERVES ENTRY OF PLEAS.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DALLET, Branch 40.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 40.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
